items.message: No further flood impacts are expected in this area, and the flood alert has been removed for the North Sea Coast at Bridlington this morning (Thursday). We will continue to monitor the situation and issue alerts and warnings as necessary.

River levels have risen at the Mansfield The Dykes river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from today, 20/10/22.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow on 21/10/22.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. 

This message will be updated by this evening, 20/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leen, Day Brook and Tottle Brook in Nottinghamshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Bulwell river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  
Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is today, 20/10/22.  
Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas, low lying land and roads around the Tottle Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow on 21/10/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated this evening, 20/10/22, or as the situation changes.
